2008T202-d-02-16-08-BB.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 1300 HOURS, CSX TRAIN D99416 WAS SWITCHING IN THE BBRR YARD AT DOSWELL, VA.  THE CSX TRAIN CREW WAS SETTING OUT CARS IN THE BANK TRACK AND PICKING UP CARS IN THE #4 TRACK.  ALL SWITCHING WAS ACCOMPLISHED FROM THE SOUTH END OF THE YARD, WHICH IS ALSO IN AN INTERLOCKING PLANT CONTROLLED BY THE CSX CQ DISPATCHER.  THE CREW CONDUCTED THE INITIAL SHOVING MOVE FROM THE RF&P SUB #3 TRACKINTO THE BB #4 TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE SOUTH CROSSOVER SWITCH AND HAD THE ENGINEER MOVE THEINBOUND CUT OF CARS INTO THE BANK TRACK.  AFTER THE CUT WAS PLACED AND SECURED, THE CONDUCTOR HAD THE ENGINEER MOVE SOUTH.  THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN WAS IN THE INTERLOCKING PLANT; THE ENGINEER CONTACTED THE CQ DISPATCHER TO OBTAIN AUTHORIZATION TO MOVE NORTH INTO THE #4 TRACK ONCE AGAIN.  THE ENGINEER CHECKED WITH THE CONDUCTOR (AFTER RECEIVING AUTHORIZATION); THE CONDUCTOR TOLD THE ENGINEER THAT ALL SWITCHES WERE LINED FOR THE MOVEMENT INTO THE #4 TRACK FOR THE PICKUP.  DURING THIS TIME ONE OF THE SWITCHES WAS NOT CORRECTLY LINED FOR THE MOVEMENT.  WHEN THE MOVEMENT WAS MADE, THE NORTH SWITCH OF THE CROSSOVER FROM #4 TRACK TO THE BANK TRACK WAS RUN THROUGH.  THE TRAIN WAS COUPLED TO THE OUTBOUND CUT OF CARS, THE EOT HUNG, AND BRAKE TEST COMPLETED.  THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN WAS STILL FOULING THE RF&P MAIN TRACK (TRACK #3); THE ENGINEER BACKED THE TRAIN NORTH APPROXIMATELY 150` TO CLEAR.  WHEN THE TRAIN RECEIVED AUTHORIZATION TO LEAVE, THE ENGINEER STARTED PULLING SOUTH OVER THE RUN

583992-d-02-09-08-GTW.Narrative: R99061-08 WAS ON THE SWITCHING LEAD AND MOVING THROUGH THE CROSSOVER OFF THE SWITCHING LEAD TO THE SOUTHBOUND PULLER WHEN R98261-09 WAS PULLING 52 CARS NORTH OUT OF TRACK NR01 AND COLLIDED WITH THE SIDE OF R99061-08.  THE COLLISION DERAILED UNIT GTW 4614 & CAR FTTX 972128.  ALSO DAMAGED, BUT NOR DERAILED, WERE CARS FTTX 975129 & FTTX 970830.  APPROXIMATELY 400 GALLONS OF FUEL LEAKED FROM THE DAMAGED FUEL TANK ON UNIT GTW 4614.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT  THE ENGINEER FAILED TO OPERATE AT RESTRICTED SPEED ON OTHER THAN MAIN TRACK INSIDE YARD LIMITS.  WHEN HE FAILED TO STOP SHORT OF THE TRAIN USING THE CROSSOVER FROM THE SWITCHING LEAD TO THE SOUTH BOUND PULLER. IT RESULTED INTHE SIDESWIPE.

TRAIN WAS RUNNING AT 16 MPH THRU THE TURNOUT WHEN EMERGENCY WAS APPLIED AND THE SLACK ACTION CAUSED FOUR LOADED CARS TO DERAIL.  DERAILMENT OCCURRED ON GTW MAIN LINE CWR TRACKS BUT ALSO CAUSED APPROX. $14,000 IN DAMAGE TO TRACKS & SIGNALS MAINTAINED BY CONRAIL, REPORT #54083.

584700-d-02-15-08-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
584700-d-02-15-08-IC.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
584700-d-02-15-08-IC.Narrative: R91271-15 WAS PULLING 57 CARS OUT OF TRACK MO30 WHEN 6 LOADED CARS ROLLED OUT OF TRACK M027 AND STRUCK THE SIDE OF GCCX 174226 DERAILING IT AND TWO MORE CARS.  THREE OF THE CARS THAT ROLLED OUT WERE DAMAGED BUT NOT DERAILED IN THE IMPACT.  THE CARS IN TRACK MO27 HAD BEEN KICKED INTO THE TRACK BUT ROLLED BACK OUT AND INTO THE SIDE OF R91271-15.  INVESTIGATION INTO THIS INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CARSWERE SECURED IN THE HUMP YARD WITH 2 HANDBRAKES, WHICH WAS THE CURRENT PROCEDURE IN THE YARD.  THE HUMP CREW INVOLVED FOLLOWED INSTRUCTIONS AND DID NOTHING WRONG TO CAUSE THIS INCIDENT.  THERE HAS BEEN A REVIEW OF THESE PROCEDURES AND IT WAS DECIDED THAT WHEN HUMPING CARS, HANDBRAKES SHOULD BE APPLIED TO 3 CARS TO PREVENT SIMILAR ROLL OUT INCIDENTS IN THE HUMP YARD.

D660608-d-02-13-08-ABS.Narrative: THE WESTBOUND ARTESIA TURN WAS PULLING 151 CARS THROUGH THE REFORM SIDING TO CUT OFF THE REAR 40 CARS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CARS TO THE KCS AT ARTESIA. HEAD END OF TRAIN EXITED THE SIDING ONTO THE MAIN TRACK WESTBOUND, AND WHEN THE HEAD END WAS APPROXIMATELY 20 CAR LENGTHS WEST OF THE SWITCH, THEENGINEER FELT A STRONG TUG AND A JERK, AND WHEN HE LOOKED BACK SAW CARS ROLLING OVER. THE TRAIN WENTIN EMERGENCY, AND THE REAR SECTION OF TE TRAIN CAME IN AGAINST THE ROLLED OVER CARS AND JACKNIFED AN ADDITIONAL 5 CARS. THE 14TH- 22TH CARS DERAILED, WITH THE 15TH-17TH CARS ON THEIR SIDES, AND THE 18TH-22ND CARS JACKNIFED. TRAIN SPEED WAS APPROX. 7 MPH. TRAIN WEIGHT WAS 11, 024 TONS AND 8306 LENGTH. THERE ARE NO HAZMAT CARS INVOLVED AND NO INJURIES OCCURED.
